articles.headline: Glaxo’s Legal Problems Lead to New $3.4 Billion Charge
articles.snippet: The move, prompted by claims over the diabetes drug Avandia and inquiries into sales practices, will effectively wipe out its quarterly profit.
articles.abstract: The move, prompted by claims over the diabetes drug Avandia and inquiries into sales practices, will effectively wipe out its quarterly profit.
articles.lead_paragraph: The British drug maker GlaxoSmithKline announced Monday that it was setting aside $3.4 billion  wiping out fourth-quarter profit  to pay for United States government investigations and product liability cases over its marketing of the diabetes drug Avandia.

articles.headline: G.E. to Share Jet Technology With China in New Joint Venture
articles.snippet: General Electric wants to remain an important supplier to the Chinese aviation industry as it tries to challenge Boeing and Airbus in making commercial jetliners.
articles.abstract: General Electric wants to remain an important supplier to the Chinese aviation industry as it tries to challenge Boeing and Airbus in making commercial jetliners.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by David Barboza, Christopher Drew and Steve Lohr and written by Mr. Lohr.
articles.byline: By David Barboza, Christopher Drew and Steve Lohr

articles.headline: Leading in 3-D TV, Breaking Japan’s Glass Ceiling
articles.snippet: Toshiba is a rare example of a company tapping what some economists call Japan’s least used resource: women.
articles.abstract: Toshiba is a rare example of a company tapping what some economists call Japan’s least used resource: women.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO  It is the Achilles’ heel of 3-D television: the clunky glasses that viewers must wear to see images pop out in 3-D.

articles.headline: A Deep Bench of Leadership at Apple
articles.snippet: A decision by Steven P. Jobs, the chief executive, to take leave puts a spotlight on several executives, in particular Timothy D. Cook, who will take over day-to-day operations.
articles.abstract: A decision by Steven P. Jobs, the chief executive, to take leave puts a spotlight on several executives, in particular Timothy D. Cook, who will take over day-to-day operations.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  For many people, Apple would not be Apple without Steven P. Jobs.
articles.byline: By Miguel Helft and Claire Cain Miller

articles.headline: Cut Off, Ivory Coast Chief Is Pressing for Cash
articles.snippet: Diplomats and businessman say Laurent Gbagbo is squeezing cocoa exporters and banks to pay soldiers and civil servants.
articles.abstract: Diplomats and businessman say Laurent Gbagbo is squeezing cocoa exporters and banks to pay soldiers and civil servants.
articles.lead_paragraph: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast  The global squeeze on the finances of Laurent Gbagbo, the strongman who refuses to cede power after losing a presidential election here, has included sanctions, asset freezes and financial interdictions, all in the hope of dislodging him without military force.

articles.headline: More Officials Quit in Tunisia Amid Protests
articles.snippet: A wave of resignations by ministers from opposition parties weakened the interim government.
articles.abstract: A wave of resignations by ministers from opposition parties weakened the interim government.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUNIS  The new unity government of Tunisia tottered Tuesday as at least four cabinet members resigned after street protests erupted over its continued domination by members of the ruling party of the ousted dictator, Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali.
articles.byline: By David D. Kirkpatrick and Kareem Fahim
